org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf
Class TemplateJMFMessageFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf.JMFMessageFactory
      org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf.DefaultJMFMessageFactory
          org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf.TemplateJMFMessageFactory

public class TemplateJMFMessageFactory
extends DefaultJMFMessageFactory

An implementation of JMFMessageFactory that uses template XML files to create JDF elements. To be recognized by this factory the template XML files must be in a package "jmf_templates" located in the classpath.

Author:
Claes Buckwalter (clabu@itn.liu.se)

Method Detail

createJMF

public org.cip4.jdflib.jmf.JDFJMF createJMF(java.lang.String templateName)
Creates a new JMF message from a template file. If no template file is found with the specified name then the super class's implementation of this method is used, see DefaultJMFMessageFactory.createJMF(String).

When creating a JMF message the path to the template file used is constructed from the specified element name using the following pattern:

jmf_templates/templateName.xml

Overrides:
createJMF in class DefaultJMFMessageFactory
Parameters:
templateName - an identifier for the type of message to create
Returns:
See Also:
DefaultJMFMessageFactory.createJMF(String)
